conversation.text: Hi!  Are you ready to start baking some whole wheat sugar cookies?

No - you won't need to grease them.  But if you've had trouble with cookies sticking to the sheets before, you could use some parchment paper to cover them and that will prevent sticking.

conversation.text: OK - all ready.  What's next?

Let's gather your ingredients. 2 cups (260 g) of whole-wheat flour.

conversation.text: OK - what is a softened 1 egg?
Ah - the butter is the ingredient that needs to be softened.  You can do this by briefly microwaving or by removing from the fridge 30 minutes before you start baking.

conversation.text: OK.  What's next?
Grab a large bowl and put all of the ingredients except for the flour ito the bowl.  With an electric mixer, beat the ingredients on medium speed until all of the ingredients are combined.
evidence: st measure out the most of the dough ingredients into the bowl. Beat them with an electric mixer on medium speed until they're combined. You'll need: 1 cup (200 g) of granulated sugar 1 teaspoon of baking powder ½ teaspoon of salt ½ teaspoon of ground nutmeg ½ teaspoon of baking soda 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of milk 1 tablespoon of lemon or orange zest 1 teaspoon of vanilla ½ cup (113 g) of butter, softened 1 egg

conversation.text: OK - I have a ixture.  Should I add the flour now?

Yes. Turn the speed to low on the mixer, add the flour and mix until all of the ingredients are combined.  Make sure there are no dry pockets.  Don't mix too much though or the cookies will be tough!!
evidence: Turn the mixer speed down to low and gradually stir in 2 cups (260 g) of whole-wheat flour. Mix the dough together until the flour is incorporated and you don't see any dry pockets.

conversation.text: Great.  All done! What's next?
Is all the flour mixed in properly so there are no dry pockets?
evidence: flour is incorporated and you don't see any dry pockets.
flour is incorporated and you don't see any dry pockets.

conversation.text: Yes - it all looks mixed in now.

OK - time to start making your cookies ready for baking.  First of all, using a cookie scoop (or 2 teaspoons)  measure out your dough a roll each portion between the palms of your hand to amke a small ball of dough.

conversation.text: OK done.  Should I do the rest now?
How big is the ball?
evidence: Roll each portion of dough between the palms of your hands to make a smooth ball of dough. Place all of the balls of dough on the ungreased cookie sheets and leave about 2-inches (5 cm) of space in between them. Each ball should be about 1-inch (2.5 cm) in size.

Perfect!  Place the ball on the sheet and make the other balls the same size.  Make sure you leave 2inches (5cm) between each of the balls.

conversation.text: OK - all done.

conversation.text: How flat?  Like 5mm thick?
No - they will be crispy and brittle if you do that.  About 1cm thick will ensure they remain soft and delcious.
Ah OK.  They are all done and there is plenty of space between each cookie.  Should I put them in the oven now?

evidence: Mix together the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon in a small bowl. Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar mixture over the cookies. You could also play around with the flavors. Try substituting ground nutmeg or cocoa for the cinnamon.

evidence: Try substituting ground nutmeg or cocoa for the cinnamon.

conversation.text: I like cinammon too.
OK.  Mix 1/2 a teaspoon of cinammon with 2 tablespoons of sugar in a small bowl.  Sprinkle the mixture over the cookies.

conversation.text: Excellent.  All done.  It already smells good.  Time for the oven now?

recipe.title: How to Make Whole Wheat Sugar Cookies

procedure.summary: Preheat the oven and get out your baking sheets.
procedure.description: Turn on the oven to 375 degrees F (175 C). You'll need to have a few baking sheets ready to put the cookies on. You won't need to grease or spray the baking sheets. If your cookies frequently stick to the pans, consider laying a sheet of parchment paper on the pans.

procedure.summary: Measure and combine most of the dough ingredients.
procedure.description:
Since this easy whole wheat sugar cookie recipe comes together in one large mixing bowl, just measure out the most of the dough ingredients into the bowl. Beat them with an electric mixer on medium speed until they're combined. You'll need:
1 cup (200 g) of granulated sugar
1 teaspoon of baking powder
½ teaspoon of salt
½ teaspoon of ground nutmeg
½ teaspoon of baking soda
2 tablespoons (30 ml) of milk
1 tablespoon of lemon or orange zest
1 teaspoon of vanilla
½ cup (113 g) of butter, softened
1 egg

procedure.summary: Stir in the flour and finish mixing the dough.
procedure.description: Turn the mixer speed down to low and gradually stir in 2 cups (260 g) of whole-wheat flour. Mix the dough together until the flour is incorporated and you don't see any dry pockets. Avoid over mixing the dough since this can make the cookies tough.

Use a cookie scoop or two teaspoons to measure out a few tablespoons of dough. Roll each portion of dough between the palms of your hands to make a smooth ball of dough. Place all of the balls of dough on the ungreased cookie sheets and leave about 2-inches (5 cm) of space in between them. Each ball should be about 1-inch (2.5 cm) in size.

Use the palm of your hand or a glass to slightly flatten each ball of dough a little. Mix together the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon in a small bowl. Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar mixture over the cookies. You could also play around with the flavors. Try substituting ground nutmeg or cocoa for the cinnamon.

procedure.summary: Bake the whole wheat sugar cookies.
procedure.description: Place the cookies in the preheated oven and bake them for 8 to 10 minutes. The cookies should puff up and crack a little bit once they're baked. They'll also turn light brown around the edges. Remove them from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack. If you have to bake the cookies in batches, avoid placing cold cookie dough on hot baking sheets. Let the sheets cool completely before using them again.
